After Action Report.

Here's what I did: I turned the virtual beer into real one (and a bottle of cider, but that's for the pulled pork that's cooking while I'm playing), put aside my Might and Magic III playthrough, and started hacking away.

Thanks for the nod on the skill and ability preferences. I mean, look at the guy's face, that's way more like 12 Wis than 8 :) I was also toying with the idea of 14 Int at the cost of Con and leaving Wis at 8, but didn't find any really useful skill for MTS. For Aielund, I'd do it and max Persuade for a cooler RP experience, if you can stomach the idea of a dwarven diplomat.

In the beginning with such builds, you're struggling for AC, especially since you don't have any kind of concealment yet (and no UMD). AB isn't sky-high either. I gracefully skipped over the most painful bits, as a pure dex-monk is probably the weakest low-level character, but there's nothing to do about that other than suck it up (or skip it, like I did!)
I quickly ditched the initial robes for Vestivius' +5 robes and haste boots, an unbuffed AC of 37 is comfortable in the beginning of MTS. I didn't kill V because I wanted the cloak, but just for the heck of it, honestly, I didn't remember what he dropped.
The effects of Def stance can definitely be felt, but there are still too many 20s. I can't wait for ED and Empty Body.
HiPS is ridiculous as always. Pull with a bow, hide, mess up the stragglers. Or assassinate the caster, hide, reposition. MTS features many true seers, though.

THE SPEED IS GOOD.
Minotaurs outdoors + 3 risen monks (West, East, South) -  barely beat one minotaur pack unbuffed without tricks, rushing in, using IKD. With potions, I lost 1/2 health, with bow/HiPS abuse (i.e. playing intelligently), virtually nothing. Potions make a big difference, but I'll try and only use them when it'd get really rough otherwise. Same for drinking healing potions.
Badric residence - I always get freaked out when the Minstrels use EYE RAYS. (I play on HC, petrification makes you a Peter forever.)
Sewers lvl 1 - poison immunity is nice against the spiders. Sewage cubes generally missed their acid attacks, have 10 DR against fist. Also, because I was lower level, fewer ones spawned. I didn't know it was a thing in MTS. Needed drinks after several battles. Umber hulks are a joke. Hit level 16. Getting 13 HP with 10 Con feels weird :) Confirmed, at level 16, more cubes spawn, take forever (3-4 rounds per cube) to kill. Being Hungarian, I take offense at not being able to solve a cube quickly. Against 5-6 cubes, had to HiPS away and heal, even with potions active, or abuse the terrain to separate them.
White Wolf Inn - maybe ditching Discipline was not such a good idea against Taunts. HiPS to the rescue.

Off we go to Susymog. Nearing the endgame, I'm slightly concerned about my 63 AC, which is definitely too little against the final boss, I think. Let's see what loot comes up.
The Tower: As soon as I see the blue hell hound Bohemoths, I recall that Susymog is a blue pit fiend. Bohemoths have a giant health pool, but are otherwise unremarkable. In Susymog's chambers, when the melee miniboss is surrounded by a huge number of monsters, but only the boss has true sight, you have a very easy way to single out the boss by sneaking. Bhe Bloodfiend Reaver's reflect aura wears off after only a few rounds, when there are a lot of them, I just wait it out hidden.
Another miniboss, Herald Decius, puts up Wounding Whispers, but now I have a sonic immunity ring.
This is the point in the game where the really crazy loot starts to drop, like a +9 ring of prot with +6 regen (I take the 1 AC hit and swap it on for my +10 ring, I've had no regen for basically the entire playthrough, and it's good for a lazy person), poison and disease immunity (not that I needed those), or a helm with +8 deflection, +6 CON and STR, crit immunity, KD immunity, and true seeing, as well as the first of the +12 ability stuff. I have no fear immunity items atm, but I believe mind spell immunity protects from fear, which we'll soon find out.
I really like MTS as a great hack and slash diversion with an OK story and a very epic scope, but if it had, say, WoG's balance, it would be the best combat module ever, not to mention it would make a lot of build choices a lot more interesting.
Lord Susymog is a true seer, the 6 lords of the pit aren't, so he is pulled alone and kept on the ground for the fight. He even rolled a natural 1 twice on his save against the on-hit glove stun. The Lords of the Pit are weaklings at this point, I just use Empty Body, Flurry of Blows, and auto-attack them to death with barely losing anything. The area is really easy, so far MTS2 has offered very little challenge. I know it's going to ramp up near the end. Level 35, and Armour Skin! The "natural +2 to AC" in the description should have gotten whoever put it that way fired. It's innate, or bonus, or additional, or whatever, but not natural, as that is a specific type of non-stacking AC. IIRC, RDD's descriptions have the same issue.
Fallen Guardians are now officially my favourite enemy in MTS: one tried to dispel the stun I put on another one <3
I fail to notice that Sanguinius has true seeing, so he buffs up, but has so little health that even with Elemental Shield he dies way faster than I lose health. Malphaedor has a Summoned Badger (<3, this is the most adorable area ever), and gets a Greater Ruin off, which fails to do anything (65 positive damage from a level 10 spell is nothing at this point.) It's a nice touch that his equipment is almost the same as MTS1 Malphaedor's (his robes and gloves are upgraded, but he drops the same kama and amulet.)
With all the stuff dropped, I manage to get my AC to 74, much better, and now I officially look like a professional wrestler. Pimpin' screenshots at the end. I also have STR, DEX, WIS, CON maxed and have a plethora of immunities, and 5d6 sneak attack.
I make it to the portal room, and I'm off to Avernus!

Takhisis' minions are KD immune, are NOT true seers for some reason, and are no challenge (I snipe the templars first.) Cerberus warrants Def Stance over FoB, as he has respectable AB, but mostly because it's been so long since I last used DS. He has the most HP of anything so far. His range is so long that I have to cancel DS because we manoeuvre into a position where he can reach me, but I can't reach him, and DS prevents me from moving. He drops a fire immunity necklace, which I'll be keeping because I don't want to spend half an hour shooting a certain boss down in MTS3.
I say hi to Nicademus and take a nap at his place. He sells a sequencer, something I haven't noticed so far.

Realms of the dragons: I go white - green - black - blue - red. I improved evade almost everything, making the fights far less epic than intended. Takhisis hits me twice during the encounter, and Tiamat has monstrous HP, but the breath DC's are not high enough, and neither is the AB, of which she has 66 against my 74, but with Epic Dodge it's a joke. She drops the first truly WTF item, a +10 robe with Haste and +5 everything. Takhisis gets me to level 36, and that concludes MTS2!
